jv.viewer

Class PvControlMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.MenuComponent
      • java.awt.MenuBar
        • jv.viewer.PvControlMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PvControlMenu
extends java.awt.MenuBar
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Menu bar of control window, created from inside PvControl. Number and state of menu items depends on whether run as application or applet.

    Use method setEnabledMenu(int, boolean) to switch state of single menu items. Identifiers of menu items are specified in jv.object.PsViewerIf.

    See Also:
    PvControl, PvViewer, PsViewerIf, Serialized Form

      • setEnabledMenu

        public void setEnabledMenu(int menuId,
                  boolean cond)
        Enable/disable menu entries in menu bar of control window.
        Parameters:
        menuId - Id of menu to enable/disable, PsViewerIf.
        cond - true enables this menu item, otherwise disables it.
        See Also:
        PsViewerIf

      • isMenuEnabled

        public boolean isMenuEnabled(int menuId)
        Determine whether menu entry in menu bar of control window is enabled.
        Parameters:
        menuId - Id of menu to enable/disable, PsViewerIf.
        Returns:
        true if menu is enabled.
        See Also:
        PsViewerIf
